name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: No bill is perfect, but we face an unprecedented crisis. If we fail to redouble and refine our efforts, the public health risks will grow, more jobs will be lost, more small businesses will throw in the towel, and cities and towns will go bust. I’m not willing to let that happen.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: The Heroes Act also includes nearly $30 million in funding for our local election officials so they have the resources they need to run safe, accessible, and secure elections this fall.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text:
The bill provides hazard pay to essential workers who have risked their lives working during the pandemic, and supports testing, tracing, and treatment. 

To cushion the economic blow of this virus, the bill would give additional direct payments to individuals and families.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: The package also includes several bills I authored for free coronavirus treatment and vaccines for low-income individuals; expanded tax credits for small businesses to keep workers on the job; and giving our veterans a reprieve from VA debt collection.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: I’ve had hours of conversations with our local police chiefs, fire chiefs, teachers, and health care workers - all of whom are putting their lives on the line while facing the prospect of losing their jobs. They’ve had our backs, now we need to step up to have theirs.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: The Heroes Act includes $1.5 billion for New Hampshire cities, towns, and counties to sustain essential services. Unless Congress acts to support our local communities, we could see widespread layoffs, cuts to critical services, and increased taxes to make up the difference.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text:
Our frontline workers, first responders, and community members are rising to the occasion. So must Congress.

This is the first step in a process, and with bipartisan cooperation I hope we can deliver meaningful results for the American people.

Read more: https://t.co/OPqr9zevNf https://t.co/2WMLS2A7uc

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text:
Our country and our economy are depending on us to come together - across party lines - to make PPP more flexible, more generous, and more responsive to the needs of Main Street.

I will continue to advocate for these solutions in the upcoming COVID-19 response packages.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: To be eligible for loan forgiveness, businesses can allocate no more than 25% of PPP loans to non-payroll expenses. Given that many NH employers still face high overhead costs and relatively low payroll expenses, this threshold should be raised by at least 15%.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: Instead of starting once funds are disbursed, small businesses should be allowed greater flexibility to determine when the forgiveness period begins. If the covered period is better timed to coincide with the needs of local businesses, more can take advantage of this program.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: It will take time for our economy to return to pre-pandemic levels. That's why small businesses should have the ability to renew their PPP loans, offering businesses greater flexibility to determine when the program’s loan forgiveness period will begin

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text:
In my conversations with hundreds of NH small business owners, I've heard their concerns about the Paycheck Protection Program - improvements are needed.

That's why I'm calling on House leadership to ensure PPP can better meet the needs of Main Street.

https://t.co/qEkvNVZxqi

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: The legislation would provide debt repayment relief for small businesses by giving the @SBAgov Administrator broad authority to defer payments on existing SBA loans for affected businesses.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: It would authorize @SBAgov to provide up to $15,000 in grant funding for each small business or nonprofit that applies for an EIDL loan, to be distributed within three days so that they can receive immediate relief

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: This bill would expand the availability of zero-interest, zero-fee EIDL loans to affected small businesses and provide at least $350 billion in loan authority to help businesses affected by the COVID-19 outbreak.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: ACERTs allow law enforcement and first responders to connect with local child specialists and professionals to intervene and mitigate the impacts of childhood trauma as soon as the scene is clear to begin making a difference.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: Adverse Childhood Experiences, or ACEs, are events which have a heavy impact on the future wellbeing, success, or risk of violence of children. This bill would create ACE Response Teams (ACERTs) to deploy and provide services and care to children after these experiences.

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text:

https://t.co/ibeiPqo0g1

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweet_text: OAWP is failing to fulfill its critical mission by not effectively shielding whistleblowers from retaliation, holding high ranking VA officials accountable or implementing the necessary policies to conduct thorough, sound, and accurate investigations.
